I've been playing this game since early 2000. After loosing access to my old steam account, now I'm glad to have this again. I spent thousands of hours with this game. I still like playing it even though the graphics is way behind the current games. Many servers became inactive now but still some are currently populated by long time players. The more you play it, the more it becomes addictive. it's fun to play a capture the flag WWII game. Like someone said here "Old but Gold". it's truly a fantastic game!
It doesn't matter if the servers are empty sometimes, this game is classic!
j'ai vu valve alors j'ai dit "je prend" mais j'y joue jamais .....triste !! pourtant sa aurais pu me plaire ...... en 2003
A tried and true classic fps. Very well balanced with an amazing community.

Day of Defeat es un juego multijugador de disparos en primera persona (FPS) basado y ambientado en varios sucesos que transcurrieron en Europa durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Este videojuego comenzÃ³, como tantos otros, como un mod del Half-Life, y fue creado en el aÃ±o 2001. MÃ¡s tarde, la empresa Valve comprÃ³ al grupo DoD (Desarrolladores de Day of Defeat hasta ese momento), y en el aÃ±o 2003 lanzaron oficialmente la versiÃ³n 1.0
En DoD podemos elegir jugar en 23 mapas diferentes, cada uno contemplando un escenario de batallas histÃ³ricas que ocurrieron en la 2da Guerra Mundial. Una vez que estemos dentro del mapa, tendremos que elegir para cuÃ¡l de los dos bandos luchar, los del Eje (Alemania Nazi), o los Aliados (Estados Unidos o Reino Unido). TambiÃ©n, cuando seleccionemos para que lado pelear, podremos manejar diferentes clases de soldados, los cuales se diferencian por el tipo de arma que llevan, ya sean Bazookas, subfusiles, rifles, o ametralladoras. A su vez, todas las clases llevan una pistola, un arma de mano (Pala o cuchillo), y algunos pueden llevar granadas.
La finalidad de este tÃ­tulo pasa por la captura de los puntos (ya sean capturar banderas o ciertos objetivos), o destruir objetivos (Con bazookas o plantando cargas de explosivos). El juego termina cuando se acaba el tiempo lÃ­mite o al momento en que un equipo captura todos los puntos. Sumado a esto, el bando que consiga hacerse con mÃ¡s objetivos cuando finalice el tiempo, es el ganador.

Nos encontramos ante un tÃ­tulo hÃ­brido, ya que posee caracterÃ­sticas muy similares a las del Counter Strike 1.6, y ademÃ¡s toma algunos aspectos de Team Fortress Classic, en conjunto a una ambientaciÃ³n de enfrentamientos histÃ³ricos. La dificultad de este juego pasa por aprenderse bien el recoil de las armas, conocer a fondo cada una de las clases que ofrecen los del Eje o los Aliados, y emplear todo eso de una manera tÃ¡ctica y coordinada con tus compaÃ±eros de equipo. Todo esto hace de Day of Defeat un muy buen juego para su momento, transformÃ¡ndolo en otra gran alternativa de CS 1.6 y TFC.
Great game! Way better than the Scource version! The player base is really small and almost non existent on off hours.

Day of Defeat is one of Valve's classic MP games in the GoldSrc engine. Set in World War II, you can play as either Allied or Axis soldiers, with objective based maps, not unlike Counter-Strike. Of course, there's no hostage rescue or the like here; the objectives are capturing control points across the map, or defending them from the enemy.

There are different classes you can choose, each with their own weapons, and they even differ between factions, with each one getting historically accurate weapons. Or at least it seems that way, as I'm by no means an expert in WWII.

While I haven't played much, I enjoyed the little I played; which was mostly in the map based on the Normandy landings. Storming that beach was really fun, even in the old graphics of GoldSrc. It's a shame Day of Defeat: Source didn't get an official version of that map.

Overall, it's an enjoyable MP game.

Every one of the maps are brilliant, all the weapons are fun to use and balanced, the graphics look cool, the movement is great, the hitboxes are good, one-hit-kills, everything about this game is great, very fun! Would definately recommend. Very high quality.
